meanings.definition: Resembling chalk in color or texture.
meanings.sent1: The walls of the old house were chalkier than the new ones.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a chalkier shade of blue for the sky in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The chalkier clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her skin turned chalkier as she grew paler from the cold.
meanings.sent5: The chalkier snow on the mountain glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Becoming more like chalk in color or texture.
meanings.sent1: The leaves on the tree were getting chalkier as autumn approached.
meanings.sent2: The fabric became chalkier after multiple washes.
meanings.sent3: The chalkier appearance of the cake made it seem like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His hair turned chalkier with each passing year.
meanings.sent5: The chalkier sands along the shore sparkled in the morning light.
